attributes.action: prosecute prostitutes to a greater extent than their customers.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current situation nearly always results in the "customer" being prosecuted, and the prostitute being let-off with countless warnings.

Why on earth is this the case?

The law is far harsher on drug-dealers than it is on drug-takers for example, so why not apply the same rational logic with prostitution?

These prostitutes are illegally offering sex on a regular basis, and are therefore the direct and main cause of the crime - just like drug dealers.

There is an endless 'supply' of potential customers for this crime, but only a limited number of people who would actually lower themselves to become prostitutes.

Prosecuting this smaller group of people will be a lot simpler, and a lot more effective.

Let common sense prevail.

reasons: False or incomplete name or address information
